titleStmt.title: Siuqila too good, to be true : omen : though so at a vewe yet all I tolde you is true, I vpholde you, now cease to aske why? for I can not lye : herein is shewed by way of dialogue, the wonderful maners of the people of Mauqsun, with other talke not friuolous.
titleStmt.author: Lupton, Thomas.

titleStmt.title: Siuqila too good, to be true : omen : though so at a vewe yet all I tolde you is true, I vpholde you, now cease to aske why? for I can not lye : herein is shewed by way of dialogue, the wonderful maners of the people of Mauqsun, with other talke not friuolous.
titleStmt.author: Lupton, Thomas.

publicationStmt.publisher: By H. Bynneman, dwelling in Thames Streate, neere vnto Baynards Castell,

notesStmt.note: "Seen and allowed according to the order appointed."
A dialogue between Suiqila and Omen about Mauqsun, a kind of utopia.
Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
